intro: Trichodium scabrum, commonly known as rough trichodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near water bodies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
